lexUnit.name: generous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: freely giving more of something, especially money, than is strictly necessary or expected.

sentence.text: CONTRARY to popular belief , a £1m damages award is not over generous when a young person suffers severe brain damage in a road accident .
It had overlooked the fact , however , that the Americans tend to be more generous when pouring drinks and like to add large ice cubes to their favourite tipple .
Mr Budgen was generous in his admiration for Mr Powell -- ` You are the great don of parliamentary debate " -- but not in much else .
He was generous in spirit , often refusing to hurt an opponent if this one was in trouble .
To date parishioners have been extremely generous in their giving and the scheme has proved a great success .
This time Osborn was much more generous in his comments to Mumford : ‘ a far better statement of the problem than the LCC Plan …
Nor was the Soviet Union at this stage inclined to be particularly generous in its terms .
Bromhead was shrewd in his advice and generous in his support .
I 'll be generous in other ways -- I 'll even put my intentions in writing if that will help persuade you of my sincerity .
He said : ` We consider our offers to be reasonable and generous in the circumstances and we are disappointed that none of these were taken up . "
John Piper may have been a foolish man in many ways but he was always friendly and generous to all classes of people .
` Oh , he was very generous to all his friends , but we always seemed to be in the wrong line . "
` I got a great reception but the club were always generous to me when I played and managed here .
` And he is generous to the point where he would be without money himself to help someone .
She notes that the Heinz family has been extraordinarily generous to the gallery over the years .
Your tutor may be generous to a fault but can not reward irrelevance or peripheral knowledge display .
Naomi 's parents , in grief and regret , had been generous to their grandchildren .
May we be generous with our friendship and learn to be forgiving .
Dick was generous with his praise for Bill 's instruction .
He made short shrift of fools and knaves , but was human , too , and generous with his money and his time .
I just wish that Sam had n't been so generous with the wine , though .
People have been very generous with their donations .
If the god was feeling generous towards the victim , he would instead be turned into a fruit bat , to serve Camazotz and his court .

It had always been generous in terms of sick pay and sympathetic and understanding towards employees with family problems , though it expected high standards of dress and deportment and lateness , absenteeism and incivility were not tolerated .
Hillary is more generous towards trekkers whose behaviour , he argues , has improved .
` This is very generous of you , Pip .
Some private sector occupational schemes are generous towards widows , especially if the death occurs in service .
` How generous of you , " he drawled with heavy sarcasm .
I think it 's so generous of you to let him stay on here . "
Not that he could complain : his old school friend had been extremely generous in offering him such a pleasant room in his spacious flat for only four pounds a week .
Perhaps I was wrong , but I could not see that the King was being kind and generous in ordering such an inhuman punishment .
He has been most generous in giving way .
She was extremely generous to aspiring young art historians .
There is a generous buffet served to guests each morning at breakfast and offering a wide choice with evening dinner .
I took a few generous swigs from one of the bottles .
Lambeth also offers slightly more generous income multiples , with a maximum three times first income plus 1.5 times second income .
He had a dangerous , Richard Burton quality about him and , when sober , he was funny , warm and generous .
He was very generous , he gave me anything I wanted .
Then the mists heaved and Garvey reappeared , his arm round the traveller 's shoulders and that great generous smile beaming into the stranger 's face .
Please use the enclosed envelope to give a generous gift to Goodwill today !
Support Goodwill with a generous donation today .
Use the enclosed card and give a generous gift to Goodwill today !
